meanings.definition: An estimate based on a mixture of guesswork and calculation.
meanings.sent1: My guesstimate is that there are about 100 jellybeans in the jar.
meanings.sent2: She made a guesstimate of how much paint would be needed for the room.
meanings.sent3: The guesstimate of how many balloons it would take to lift a person was way off!
meanings.sent4: His guesstimate of the distance to the moon was as accurate as throwing darts blindfolded.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's guesstimate of the age of the dinosaur fossil was surprisingly close to the actual age.

meanings.definition: To estimate something without precise information.
meanings.sent1: I had to guesstimate the number of people at the party since I arrived late.
meanings.sent2: He tends to guesstimate the time it will take to finish a project rather than calculate it precisely.
meanings.sent3: Trying to guesstimate how many grains of sand are on the beach is a fun challenge.
meanings.sent4: She guesstimated the weight of the pumpkin by comparing it to a bag of flour.
meanings.sent5: The detective had to guesstimate the suspect's height based on the height of the door handle he touched.
